quote: Though the picture rightfully belongs to Bassett, a final word must be said about Fishburne, who never fails to make Ike seem human if not defensible. Even in defeat, he is remarkably compelling.

title: What's Love Got to Do with It

quote: A splashy, volatile, crowd- pleasing rock-star melodrama that makes up in sheer emotional wallop what it sometimes lacks in finesse.

quote: It's a simple, appealing premise and filmmaker Spike Lee uses it to full comic advantage.

title: The Omen

quote: A member of the Exorcist family, it is a dreadfully silly film, which is not to say that it is totally bad.
title: The Omen

quote: As long as movies like The Omen are merely scaring us, they're fun in a portentous sort of way.
title: The Omen

quote: An amusingly caustic, straight-up serving of film noir staples spiced with star charisma.
title: Blood and Wine

quote: An engrossing thriller - and one sparkling with intelligence, with the surprising twists grounded in credible human behaviour.
title: Blood and Wine

quote: When Bob Rafelson decides to get nasty, he really means it.
title: Blood and Wine

quote: It's a morality play, really, but dripping with humid sex and violence.
title: Blood and Wine

quote: The movie's own payoff is compelling enough, but the project has a weightless feel that limits involvement. Better you give it an hour-and-a-half on video someday, surrounded by wine and snacks.
title: Blood and Wine

quote: Rafelson is so true to his sour vision of crime, deception and a rottenness at the core of our natures -- he's as cheerful as a Jim Thompson potboiler -- that we never get a chance to like or care about his characters.
title: Blood and Wine

quote: Nicholson is good, but the movie isn't.
title: Blood and Wine

quote: The performance from newcomer Emily Watson is the centerpiece of this spiritual journey.
title: Breaking the Waves

quote: It's a remarkable achievement for all concerned, with Katrin Cartlidge, as Bess's widowed sister-in-law, sharing the acting laurels with the radiant Emily Watson, and writer/director Lars von Trier building the emotional and dramatic intensity ...
title: Breaking the Waves

quote: Watson's Bess is an unforgettable character -- simple, profound, heartbreaking, tragic and yet triumphant.
title: Breaking the Waves

quote: The punchy, nonstop visual effects crowd out coherent storytelling.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: For a good hour and change, the film is a big toy box that teases you out of the Gloom.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: It has a refreshing Old World take on a never-ending fantasy war between vampires and the forces of 'light.'
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: What a rabid beast is Night Watch. What a pungent Russian fantasy-horror cheeseathon.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: This mostly incoherent, enormously eccentric helping of mayhem breaks into so many fragments that watching the movie can be a bit like trying to assemble the pieces from several jigsaw puzzles.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: Night Watch was one of the most popular movies ever released in Russia. That just proves there's no accounting for taste, in film or in human sacrifice.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: Goth thrill-junkies will probably get a giddy charge out of this overheated fantasy. The rest of us can have an equivalent experience by putting our brains in a blender and hitting puree.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: Clarity may be lost, but rare is the movie that grabs viewers by their throats and never lets go. Bekmambetov's Night Watch is one of the grabbers.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: The faux mythology may be cheesy, the grandiose plot stretched thin and full of holes, but underneath the recycled story and style is a hint of something troubling and real.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: Even though you couldn't call it a great science fiction movie, on the level of Tarkovsky's Solaris and Stalker it's often a great, heart-pumping, blow-you- to-the walls movie experience.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: While the movie's inspirations might be glam-Hollywood action fantasies, Night Watch fairly wallows in damp, post-Soviet decay.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: Though Night Watch is impressive at creating atmosphere, the movie is an impenetrable narrative tangle with plot strands running in every direction.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: If [Director] Bekmambetov had any skill in actually telling a story, his kitchen-sink trilogy would be something to celebrate. It presently qualifies as a dubious achievement.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: Although it doesn't have Kate Beckinsale, her guns ablazin', vamped out in the latest vampire-slaying couture, Night Watch is vastly more fun than the similar-themed Underworld pics.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: Night Watch works better as a demo reel for the state of Russian effects work than as a first installment in an epic trilogy.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: Unfortunately, by Hollywood standards, Night Watch is about three Wookies and two Neos short of convincing. All the gobbledygook is in place, but the special effects are minimal and somewhat frustrating.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: The original plan was to remake Night Watch in English, and then thought was given to dubbing it. Thankfully both ideas were scuttled, as the film's Russian-ness and its allusions to post-communist fears and frustrations add greatly to its appeal.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: Night Watch is shabby chic, with hints of Russia's great silent-cinema past.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: Ultimately, it's a formulaic, predictable take on a Hollywood staple: the vampire horror film. That's a pretty tired genre, no matter what language it's told in.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: As opposed to the dreary domestic dramas that are [Russian] cinema's stock in trade, this one is a full-stops-out fantasia that is often disgustingly gloppy and looks as if it was birthed by the Wachowski brothers and Quentin Tarantino.
title: Nochnoy dozor

quote: In zooming out from Picard's glinty eyeball, this eighth feature film from the Trek factory displays a zippy new energy and a sleek, confident style fully independent of its predecessors.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: First Contact is no grab bag of camp gewgaws; it stands proud and apart, accessible even to the Trek-deficient. This old Star, it seems, has a lot of life in it.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: The elegance of the story is enhanced by the sure direction of Jonathan Frakes, who also plays Commander William Riker.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: A smashingly exciting sci-fi adventure that ranks among the very best in the long-running Paramount franchise.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: This makes little concession to non-initiates.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: The series now lacks all of its original stars and much of its earlier determination. It has morphed into something less innocent and more derivative than it used to be, something the noncultist is ever less likely to enjoy.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: The excitement comes from Frakes's direction.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: A nicely constructed science-fiction film, with a simple premise, a charismatic villain and a good back-story to enhance the action.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: Blessed with clever plot devices and a villainous horde that makes the once-dread Klingons seem like a race of Barneys, First Contact does everything you'd want a Star Trek film to do, and it does it with cheerfulness and style.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: The first stretch and the home stretch are so filled with visual interest and, more importantly, with the patented Star Trek philosophical and humorous tidbits that fans will gladly suffer the dull Borg patch for the pleasure of the rest.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: While First Contact espouses the usual lofty Trek ideals, it never forgets to factor in the fun. As the Borg likes to say, resistance is futile -- and also unnecessary.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: Star Trek: First Contact is one of the best of the eight Star Trek films: Certainly the best in its technical credits, and among the best in the ingenuity of its plot.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: Following in the wake of a trio of disappointing features, First Contact proves to be the most entertaining Star Trek in more than a decade.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: A thoroughly enjoyable visit with the crew of TV's Star Trek: The Next Generation.
title: Star Trek: First Contact

quote: Shine beams with warmth, sensitivity, and fine taste, but some of that illumination is the work of our own reflector lamps.
title: Shine

quote: [Helfgott's] extraordinary life is intelligently charted here, and the three actors who play him at different stages are all exceptional.
title: Shine

quote: Compassionate, deft, unsentimental, inspirational.
title: Shine

quote: Inspired by the real story of classical pianist David Helfgott, "Shine" re-creates that emotionally piercing story, note by memorable note.
title: Shine

quote: Shine has a story to reckon with and powerhouse male performances.
title: Shine

quote: His life story is not exactly as it is shown here, but close enough, I gather, for us to marvel at the way the human spirit can try to heal itself.
title: Shine

quote: A masterpiece of Southern storytelling.
title: Sling Blade

quote: An abundance of long, flat medium shots that rob the film of intimacy and give it a sleepy pace.
title: Sling Blade

quote: A mesmerizing parable of good and evil and a splendid example of Southern storytelling at its most poetic and imaginative.
title: Sling Blade

quote: If there were the slightest justice and curiosity in the Academy Award process, Thornton's work here would get a nomination.
title: Sling Blade

quote: In Sling Blade, Thornton lays claim to the title of hyphenate of the year.
title: Sling Blade

quote: The lure of Sling Blade is both elemental and hauntingly familiar, and I would not be surprised if Thornton's breakthrough film is one day considered a classic in its own right.
title: Sling Blade

quote: A fine motion picture.
title: Sling Blade

quote: [Thornton] does wonders with Yoakam, who could have played a standard villain but always manages to suggest a man trapped within his prejudices.
title: Sling Blade

quote: By its midpoint, however, Thornton has begun forcing both the film's poetry and the preternatural goodness of its simple-minded protagonist, and Sling Blade's sweet charms begin to curdle.
title: Sling Blade

quote: All the actors in Sling Blade do magnificent work, but it's Thornton who stays with you for days.
title: Sling Blade

quote: Sling Blade takes you down paths full of primitive, almost biblical implications, but it also finds comic relief in moments of palpable tension.
title: Sling Blade

quote: [Thornton] performance is so good that his directing may be slighted.
title: Sling Blade

quote: In this formulaic star vehicle, Schwarzenegger gets to fly like Peter Pan, act like Superman--and fulfill all the fantasies kids may have about their fathers.
title: Jingle All the Way

title: Jingle All the Way

quote: Here's Arnie, of all people, playing a bedraggled suburbanite, and his perversely amusing casting boosts a crass, sometimes nasty and finally funny celebration of holiday mass-merchandising and greed.
title: Jingle All the Way

quote: There are many good reasons for going to see The Preacher's Wife.

title: The Preacher's Wife

quote: For a movie that might have offered a new twist of the mistletoe, The Preacher's Wife delivers the Scrooge-like acceptable market minimum.
title: The Preacher's Wife

quote: The Preacher's Wife is one Christmas picture that actually is in the spirit of the season. It's warm, sentimental, amusing yet serious, bringing fantasy to bear upon the painfully real.
title: The Preacher's Wife

quote: A welcome boost for audiences seeking images of black characters without criminal tendencies.
title: The Preacher's Wife

quote: This movie could have done more, but what it does, it makes you feel good about.
title: The Preacher's Wife

quote: Penny Marshall's remake of The Bishop's Wife is very uneven -- sometimes sweet or soulful, often stiff.
title: The Preacher's Wife

quote: If not for the pervasive spirit of the season, something like this could easily send me into sugar shock. It's a little too nice and happy.
title: The Preacher's Wife

quote: As warm and cheery as a mug of hot cocoa on a frosty morn.
title: The Preacher's Wife

quote: Audiences will respond favorably to its overall warmth, and the motion picture academy may, too.
title: Ridicule

quote: Then there's always Mr. Scofield, bringing an almost unbearable, yet entirely believable, lightness of spirit to his loathsome character. It's a bold stroke by a great actor, making zealotry and evil seem positively beneficent.
title: The Crucible

quote: I recommend Hytner's movie highly, but a part of me resists a work that makes the audience feel as noble in our moral certainty as the characters it invites us to deplore. Some part of its power seems borrowed from the thing it hates.
title: The Crucible

quote: Her cheeks flush, her winsome beauty seared with erotic rage, Ryder exposes the real roots of the piece. Forget McCarthyism; The Crucible is a colonial Fatal Attraction.
title: The Crucible

quote: Too bad, though, that The Crucible fails to probe deeper into the sexual, religious, and political conditions that can give false accusations so much power -- even today.
title: The Crucible

title: The Crucible

quote: I very much admire how Hytner... keeps the pace swift and doesn't fetishize the 17th-century decors and clothes. But I can't help feeling that in more ways than one, The Crucible is a period piece.
title: The Crucible

quote: What happened in long-ago Salem does still seem to matter.
title: The Crucible

quote: Handsome and well-acted, the film's ultimate success depends on the heat between Ryder and Day-Lewis, and it simply isn't there. The attraction is fatal alright, but it certainly doesn't seem mutual.
title: The Crucible

quote: Neither the establishing dramatic linchpin nor the final conversion of conscience is terribly convincing, leaving this pared-down rendition of the original work diminished in power and meaning as well.
title: The Crucible

quote: Hytner holds the action together with solid, unflashy, well-paced direction, ensuring that this is no mere period piece but a compelling, pertinent account of human fear, frailty and cold ambition.
title: The Crucible

quote: Nothing in the movie is quite up to Scofield's Danforth. But what a mighty performance that is!
title: The Crucible

quote: Day-Lewis, Ryder and Scofield will be odds-on favorites for Oscar nominations, as will the movie itself.
title: The Crucible

quote: There's an awful, piercing truth in the performances of Daniel Day-Lewis, Winona Ryder, Joan Allen and Paul Scofield as members of a community destroyed by guilt, paranoia and betrayal.
title: The Crucible

quote: This stirring film lets you feel the heat of Miller's argument and the urgent power of his kick.
title: The Crucible

quote: Despite these involving moments, The Crucible finally seems too schematic, more useful as an allegory than as drama, and possibly owing that undoubted popularity to its simplistic qualities as much as its insights into group psychology.
title: The Crucible

quote: This version illuminates the story's numerous strengths, resulting in a motion picture of surprising emotional and intellectual impact.
title: The Crucible

quote: Though Hytner remains essentially a stage director, he makes fine use of Massachusetts locations and period interiors; some of the visual details recall Dreyer's Day of Wrath, a film that likely had an influence on Miller's play
title: The Crucible

quote: The first scene in "The Crucible'' strikes the first wrong note.
title: The Crucible

quote: It is the wittiest, most charming, least pretentious cartoon feature Walt Disney has ever made.
title: One Hundred and One Dalmatians

title: One Hundred and One Dalmatians

quote: Brilliant entertainment.
title: One Hundred and One Dalmatians

quote: A rather clever idea, if a bit unsettling.
title: One Hundred and One Dalmatians

quote: If there's one thing that's absolutely first-rate about the film, it's the character of Cruella.

quote: Nothing but a long day's journey into ennui.

quote: The expensive effects (under supervision of Douglas Trumbull) are the secret of this film, and the amazing wizardry throughout would appear to justify the whopping budget.

quote: This 1979 movie adaptation of the cult TV series is blandness raised to an epic scale.
title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture

quote: For non-addicts, the smart plot and effects go some way towards compensating for the plastic characters and costumes.
title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture

quote: [It's] like attending your high-school class's 10th reunion at Caesar's Palace. Most of the faces are familiar, but the decor has little relationship to anything you've ever seen before.
title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture

title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture

quote: These are classic directorial occasions, and Nimoy rises to them with fervor, in effect beaming his film up onto a higher pictorial plane than either of its predecessors.
title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock

quote: An emotionally satisfying science fiction adventure.
title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock

quote: This 1984 film's few and unimpressive special effects evidently qualify it as science fiction, but the genre it really belongs to is the male weepie: there hasn't been a gooier buddy romance on the screen since Joe Buck took Ratso Rizzo to Miami.
title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock

quote: Decent SFX, but a little more action wouldn't have gone amiss.
title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock

quote: This is a good but not great Star Trek movie, a sort of compromise between the first two.
title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock

quote: The humanity of the Star Trek series, unexpected as it is in a sci-fi setting, remains the series' best feature.
title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock

quote: 'Star Trek III' takes nearly forty minutes, much of which is filled with silly, mystical exposition about the current state of Spock's soul, before things start moving. The last twenty minutes are equally slow, but the stuff in between is quite enjoyable.
title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock

quote: Latest excursion is warmer, wittier, more socially relevant and truer to its TV origins than prior odysseys.
title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

quote: I suspect the unconverted will want to be beamed up pronto.
title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

quote: Kirk & Co return to present-day San Francisco to save the whales in the most enjoyable film of the series so far, also returning to the simplistic morality-play format that gave the original TV series its strength.
title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

quote: Mr. Nimoy directed this Star Trek installment, and indeed he should probably direct all of them. His technical expertise leaves much to be desired. But his sincerity is unmistakable, and it counts for a lot.
title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

quote: This is easily the most absurd of the Star Trek stories -- and yet, oddly enough, it is also the best, the funniest and the most enjoyable in simple human terms.
title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

quote: An effective and enjoyable sample of entertainment -- not good science fiction, but a lightweight piece of comic fantasy utilizing characters so familiar that they feel like old friends.
title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

quote: A happy, heartfelt chapter that reunites the original cast with the original TV format, shying away from the cold and epic scale of the preceding movie adventures.
title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

quote: Immensely pleasurable.
title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

quote: There are flashes of commercially oriented action and humor, but the overall feeling is one of a languid depression sprung straight from the heart of its author.
title: Batman Returns

quote: [Burton's] dark, melancholy vision is undeniably something to see, but it is a claustrophobic conception, not an expansive one, oppressive rather than exhilarating, and it strangles almost all the enjoyment out of this movie without half trying.
title: Batman Returns

quote: As Beetlejuice and Edward Scissorhands reminded us, Burton always has been more absorbed by what his audience sees than by what his movies say.
title: Batman Returns

quote: Batman Returns is the rarest of Hollywood beasts -- a sequel that's better than the original
title: Batman Returns

quote: Burton, once an animator at Disney, understands that to go deeper, you must fly higher, to liberation from plot into poetry. Here he's done it. This Batman soars.
title: Batman Returns

quote: As in the first movie, Burton gives the material a luxurious masked-ball quality and a sly contemporary wit without violating the myth's low, cheesy comic-book origins.
title: Batman Returns

quote: Burton and company return to the prickly humor that gave such a jolt to the earlier film -- frequently finding it in unexpected places.
title: Batman Returns

quote: This time the richness of the Batman movie is not in its production design but rather in Burton's and screenwriter Daniel Waters' Freudian view of adult human behavior.
title: Batman Returns

quote: Something about the filmmaker's eccentric, surreal, childlike images seems to strike a deep chord in the mass psyche: he makes nightmares that taste like candy.
title: Batman Returns

quote: Exhaustingly inventive.
title: Batman Returns

quote: More of the same, but nowhere near as good (funny, disturbing, obsessive) as the uneven original, revealing arrested development on every level.
title: Batman Returns

quote: Where Burton's ideas end and those of his collaborators begin is impossible to know, but result is a seamless, utterly consistent universe full of nasty notions about societal deterioration, greed and other base impulses.
title: Batman Returns

quote: Bigger, louder, more relentlessly action-packed than its predecessor, Batman Returns batters its audience into submission.
title: Batman Returns

quote: Because the film's predominant motif is that of wounded individuals re-inventing themselves as wily villains, its most memorable episodes are early ones explaining each main character's transformation.
title: Batman Returns

quote: Burton uses the summer's most explosively entertaining movie to lead us back into the liberating darkness of dreams.
title: Batman Returns

quote: Like a hyperactive 11-year-old, the director seems both uncomfortable with adult emotions and unable to focus on the overall portrait.

quote: Comes closer than ever to Bob Kane's dark, original strip, which began in 1939.
title: Batman Returns

quote: Odd and sad, but not exhilarating.

quote: Christopher Cain directed this western from a script by John Fusco, and on the whole seems much more comfortable with the scroungy and scatological dialogue than he does with the action sequences.
title: Young Guns

quote: Young Guns is best watched in the playful, none-too-serious spirit in which it was made.
title: Young Guns

quote: They behave as if our adoration were their birthright.
title: Young Guns

quote: What makes it work is its youthful vitality, the tremendous energy and imagination expended on its virtually wall-to-wall song and dance number.
title: Grease

quote: The screenplay is a prepubescent shambles, the direction is by acne out of disposable douches, the dubbing and looping of the songs is painfully obvious, the characterizations are generally repulsive and the whole thing is utterly without style.
title: Grease

title: Grease

title: Grease

quote: Grease has got it, from the outstanding animated titles of John Wilson all the way through the rousing finale as John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John ride off into teenage happiness.
title: Grease

quote: Limp, cheaply made.
title: Grease

quote: An unembarrassed movie musical, something my generation experienced only in Sunday-afternoon movies on TV.
title: Grease

quote: Its flashy opportunism (nostalgia pitched squarely at an audience too young to even recall the era) quickly becomes very irritating.
title: Grease

quote: Its sensibility is not tied to the past but to a free-wheeling, well informed, high-spirited present.
title: Grease

quote: Just an average musical, pleasant and upbeat and plastic.
title: Grease

quote: The friskiness of the performers, the choreography by Patricia Birch and most of all Travolta's phenomenal charm give it its value.
title: Grease

quote: Grease seems kickier now than it did 20 years ago.
title: Grease

quote: I don't think there's a more exciting talent at work right now than Spielberg, an authentic moviemaking prodigy, and perhaps his worst problem from June 20, 1975, on will be preventing success from making a nervous or artistic wreck of him.
title: Jaws

quote: Perhaps the most perfectly constructed horror story in our time.
title: Jaws

quote: Director Steven Spielberg has immeasurably improved the bestselling Peter Benchley potboiler novel.
title: Jaws

quote: Spielberg had paced the film beautifully so that one is always on edge, tensed for those scary moments that turn out to be false alarms, and left somehow totally unprepared for the real shocks.
title: Jaws

quote: It may be the most cheerfully perverse scare movie ever made. Even while you're convulsed with laughter you're still apprehensive, because the editing rhythms are very tricky, and the shock images loom up huge, right on top of you.
title: Jaws

quote: The result is a fast-paced, straight-line thriller that moves without pause toward the climactic contest at sea between three men and a 25-foot, 3-ton great while killer shark.
title: Jaws

quote: It is a coarse-grained and exploitive work which depends on excess for its impact. Ashore it is a bore, awkwardly staged and lumpily written.
title: Jaws

quote: What this movie is about, and where it succeeds best, is the primordial level of fear.
title: Jaws

quote: A near Hitchcockian exercise in transference of guilt and making the audience pay for its illicit pleasures.
title: Jaws

quote: Spielberg may be the man who created the new Hollywood, but in his first megahit he summed up what was best in the old -- the humor, the perversity, and the storytelling integrity of Alfred Hitchcock.
title: Jaws

quote: Mr. Spielberg has so effectively spaced out the shocks that by the time we reach the spectacular final confrontation between the three men and the great white shark, we totally accept the makebelieve on its own foolishly entertaining terms.
title: Jaws

quote: Spielberg works self-effacingly, with subtly correct camera placement and meticulous editing. He twists our guts with false alarms, giving us the real thing with heart-stopping suddenness.
title: Jaws

quote: Steven Spielberg's mechanical thriller is guaranteed to make you scream on schedule.
title: Jaws

quote: The fast-moving 124-minute film engenders enormous suspense as the shark attacks a succession of people.
title: Jaws

quote: It's no wonder a generation of holidaymakers still thinks twice before stepping into the water.
title: Jaws

quote: When it comes to this kind of thriller, no movie has been able to top Jaws, although many have tried. And, as the years go by, it seems increasingly unlikely that anything will come close.
title: Jaws

quote: One of the most effective thrillers ever made.
title: Jaws

quote: Using talent of this order on a script this weak, along with merely decorative appearances by the likes of Lauren Bacall and Wilford Brimley, amounts to the Hollywood equivalent of government waste.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: As political satire, My Fellow Americans makes a poor candidate.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: Yes, it's Grumpy Old Presidents, in which most of the comedy comes from the supposed shock of hearing two senior citizens cursing at each other in terms Beavis and Butt-head would find inelegant.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: I'd cheerfully vote the writers, director and producers of My Fellow Americans out of office.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: The movie suggests we get the government we deserve, but do we really deserve this movie?
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: It takes a special actor's grace to survive a script as lame as My Fellow Americans, and James Garner has it. Without appearing to break a sweat, Garner makes each grotesquely desperate attempt at humor look smooth and assured.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: An appalling piece of junk.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: Garner and Jack Lemmon have enough charisma, and there are enough solid laughs, to mostly overcome My Fellow Americans' embarrassing moments and improbable ending.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: Enthusiastic as one might be that Jack Lemmon has found a new lease on movie life with his Grumpy Old Men series, the funny-crankpots genre wears mighty thin on this road trip.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: Mr. Lemmon and Mr. Garner are such pros that they carry the movie smoothly over its dull patches.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: Not every joke works; some clunkers don't even come close. But just when you start to give up on it, the film comes back with a whopper that produces roars of laughter.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: Shameless laughs flow off the prefab assembly line with sufficient regularity to please audiences with a taste for comfortable tradition spiced with a bit of contempo naughtiness.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: A gang-written comedy that doesn't have a political bone in its body, or much evidence of a funny one, either.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: A very bad, uninspired comedy with slight leanings toward self-importance.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: This is not a great comedy and will be soon forgotten, but it has nice moments.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: The performers are first rate. Unfortunately, and all too often in movies these days, the script regularly lets them down.
title: My Fellow Americans

quote: Cameron has devised a tender love story between Kate Winslet and Leonardo DiCaprio that serves as the main focus of Titanic's storyline, and it works beautifully.

title: Titanic

title: Titanic

quote: Titanic provides an absorbing blend of historical fact and old-fashioned Hollywood tearjerking.
title: Titanic

quote: Titanic is indeed a ship of dreams. Climb aboard and bon voyage.
title: Titanic

quote: Take one of history's most compelling tragedies, tell it through the lives of two engaging young lovers and show it with some of the best-ever special effects and you have a dazzling, exciting movie that is also poignant and personal.
title: Titanic

title: Titanic

quote: "Titanic" still amazes as the kind of massive, build-and-destroy production that few filmmakers have the ambition or budget to make.

quote: This version has deepened and enriched a film that was already rich in emotions and remarkable for its depth of detail.

quote: Cameron is a genius at instilling narrative dread and designing a hokum-drenched fairy tale of a certain size.

quote: Like Kathy Bates' "unsinkable" Molly Brown, "Titanic" is unabashedly American: It's big, brash and sometimes gauche, yet also unapologetically earnest, amazing to look at and devoted to its own cause. And it knows how to win us over.

quote: Overall, for a blockbuster movie about one great big thing hitting another great big thing, the new film shows distinctly upper-deck restraint.

quote: If Connery was Sexy Bond and George Lazenby was One-Shot Bond and Roger Moore was Geezer Bond and Timothy Dalton was Bored Bond, then Brosnan should be Posh Bond.

Myers exploits every vicious, self-hating line that comes his way.
The triteness comes thick and fast.

The party never gets started.
Mecca of cool turns out lukewarm.

54 is an entertaining and surprisingly serious look at the infamous New York discotheque, with a genuine nostalgia for the late '70s and early '80s, tempered by a healthy dose of jaundice - but without a sense of condescension or superiority.
Except for Myers, and for many he will make the movie worth watching. He's absolutely shagadelic and completely unexpected. This should have been his movie.
You see garbage bags filled with cash, a lot of avid cocaine snorting and fleeting glimpses of Warhol and Truman Capote, but it all feels ho-hum.
A disappointingly dull film.
The trite story is a letdown because it traverses a predictable arc.
This is so dull!
Silly and clumsily made.

A good-looking, sharp-edged, entertaining, exciting space opera.
A lot of care has gone into it, but it has no satirical substructure to match that of the Kubrick film, and which was eventually responsible for that film's continuing popularity.

Now that enough time has elapsed since the release of 2010 for outraged 2001 fans to calm down, it can be seen that, while there was no decisive creative reason for Hyams' sequel to exist, it's not a bad movie.
